info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 15 at 3:05PM CDT until June 15 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Memphis TN
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following county, Carroll.
* WHEN...Until 615 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 304 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Huntingdon, Hollow Rock, Clarksburg, McLemoresville, Hillard, Palmer Shelter, Tate, Leach, Scott Hill, Jumbo, New Zion, Westport, Yuma and Jarrell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT THIS EVENING
